em.span: Our Vision is to provide a safe and caring environment in which our students can develop academically, creatively, and socially. Each member of the school community will demonstrate personal integrity, a commitment to learning, and an appreciation for cultural diversity.

span.span: The RCS and Staff wanted to share this video with our students and community as a way to say we love you, we miss you, and we can't wait to see all of you. Stay safe, be strong, and we'll see you soon.
Dear Parents/Students and Roxbury School Community:

p.span: By now you know that the Governor extended the school closure through May 15, 2020. While his decision may not have been unexpected, it was difficult to hear.
We miss being with your children each and every day. We also know that balancing your many responsibilities at home while we are closed is difficult at best.

We were so appreciative of the Family Projects that were created. A real family spirit shone through the projects. We could see the fun and excitement families had creating the projects. We thank you for your efforts.

I encourage you to keep your focus on what is most essential: the health and safety of your family, the emotional well-being of your children, and a willingness to try your best to keep your children engaged in their learning. We can’t ask for anything else.

I also want to remind you that we will continue engage your children in learning, to provide meals to children and assist with information about childcare for parents and guardians who are considered essential workers.

Thank you for continued patience and understanding during this unprecedented time for our community. We appreciate your efforts to help us stay connected with your children; nothing matters more to us.

div.a: Letter from the RCS Phys Ed Department

a.span: Follow this link to read a letter from the RCS Phys Ed Department regarding at-home physical education requirements.

span.span: Notice is hereby given that the annual Meeting and Budget Vote typically held each year on the third Tuesday in May is hereby postponed until at least June 1, 2020, and the circulation, filing, and collection of petitions for Board of Education positions are postponed pursuant to the New York State Governor’s Executive Order 202.13. Further notice will be given when more information is available.

a.span: Follow this link for resources for parents on anxiety, COVID-19, motivation, mindfulness and fun activities!

div.a: Childcare for Healthcare Workers and First Responders

div.span: If you get a chance today, please join me in thanking Heather Slauson, Marianne Schor & Wendy Greene! You are appreciated by all more than you know!
